general.name: Thomas Gilbert
general.role: Staff Software Engineer | High-Performance Web & Systems
general.pickupLine: I build high-performance web engines and data-driven experiences, bridging the gap between systems programming and the modern web.

about: I first fell into the coding rabbit hole in 1998, and that curiosity has never left me. From early desktop apps to building complex software for global leaders like Lectra, my journey has always been about one thing: making technology work better for people.

These days, I’m focused on the frontier of web performance. I love exploring modern tools like Zig and WebAssembly to bring near-native speed to the browser. My specialty is turning heavy, complex data into smooth, meaningful experiences—whether I’m architecting industrial solutions or crafting high-performance tools for the trail running community.
When I’m away from my desk, you’ll find me road or trail running, enjoying life with my wife and daughter, or getting lost in my favorite music.

tasks.description: Architecting cloud-integrated manufacturing solutions for Fashion 4.0, enhancing system scalability and developer velocity through robust TypeScript architectures and Azure integration.
Led the architecture and delivery of the Dolby.io JavaScript SDK, enabling thousands of developers to integrate high-performance WebRTC streaming with production-grade reliability.
Engineered high-performance 3D spatial audio interfaces and interactive mixers, reducing rendering overhead through optimized Three.js state management and real-time processing.
Established cross-functional Design Systems and engineering standards to accelerate product delivery across the Dolby.io ecosystem.
Developed high-precision C++ plugins for graphical data exchange, bridging the gap between CAD industrial software and creative design suites.
Optimized complex vector data transformations by integrating PLM workflows directly into Adobe Creative Cloud via custom SDK bridges.
Built critical automation frameworks for Modaris CAD applications to ensure software reliability for Tier-1 global fashion clients.
Built mission-critical command stations for X-ray generators, ensuring 100% hardware safety through low-level x86 Assembly and real-time C++ programming.
Shipped specialized hardware-software integration extensions for Windows Media Center using C# and .NET.

selectedProjects.name: Terminus
selectedProjects.description: A high-performance geospatial engine for trail runners. It leverages Zig and WebAssembly to perform complex pathfinding and elevation calculations in-browser with near-native speed.
highlights: Custom engine in Zig for sub-millisecond data processing.
Zero-copy memory architecture between Wasm and React for fluid 3D rendering.
Optimized elevation analysis algorithms for large-scale GPX datasets.

selectedProjects.name: Virtual World Demo
selectedProjects.description: An immersive spatial audio experience built for Dolby.io, showcasing real-time communication by integrating 3D environments with WebRTC audio streams.
highlights: Dynamic 3D audio positioning based on user proximity.
Seamless integration of Dolby.io SDK with React Three Fiber.

selectedProjects.name: Positic
selectedProjects.description: A lightweight, robust TypeScript library for high-precision geolocation manipulation, built for mapping and GPS-based applications.
highlights: Tree-shakable and developer-friendly API with 100% type safety.

selectedProjects.name: Ultra-Buddy
selectedProjects.description: A performance-oriented PWA for ultra-endurance athletes, transforming raw race data into pacing strategies via D3.js visualizations.
highlights: Custom D3.js race profiles for real-time effort management.
Offline-first PWA architecture for remote mountain environments.
